metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8842 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in macOS Catalina 10.15.2, Security Update 2019-002 Mojave, and Security Update 2019-007 High Sierra. In certain configurations, a remote attacker may be able to submit arbitrary print jobs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-bsd - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-client - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-core-drivers - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-daemon - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-ipp-utils - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-ppdc - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
cups-server-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
libcups2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
libcupscgi1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
libcupsimage2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
libcupsmime1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
libcupsppdc1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cups package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm1').
